episode_summary: This episode features discussions on historical figures and events, including Captain Scott's Antarctic expedition, Eleanor of Aquitaine's influence on fireplaces, the Roman Empire's use of Britain as a place of exile, and America's tree witness protection program.

facts.fact: When Captain Scott, the infamous British expedition leader, got to the South Pole, he saw in the distance a little flag fluttering and his heart sank, and then he saw a tent and inside that tent, there was a letter addressed very neatly to King Harkon of Norway.
Eleanor of Aquitaine gave us fireplaces.
When the Romans defeated barbarian tribes, they would often send them to Britain as punishment.
America has a witness protection program for their trees.
